metadata.title: CVE-2019-1549 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
OpenSSL 1.1.1 introduced a rewritten random number generator (RNG). Thiswas intended to include protection in the event of a fork() system call inorder to ensure that the parent and child processes did not share the sameRNG state. However this protection was not being used in the default case.A partial mitigation for this issue is that the output from a highprecision timer is mixed into the RNG state so the likelihood of a parentand child process sharing state is significantly reduced. If an applicationalready calls OPENSSL_init_crypto() explicitly using OPENSSL_INIT_ATFORKthen this problem does not occur at all. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1d (Affected1.1.1-1.1.1c).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-1549` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.1 - 1.1.1d-2ubuntu1
openssl - 1.1.1d-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

ovmf - 0~20191122.bd85bf54-2
qemu-efi - 0~20191122.bd85bf54-2
qemu-efi-aarch64 - 0~20191122.bd85bf54-2
qemu-efi-arm - 0~20191122.bd85bf54-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.1d-2ubuntu1').
edk2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0~20191122.bd85bf54-2').
